result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward L Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders credit of 9 days to offset the costs and DNA. Both PD IN FULL.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward L Nelson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: Oct 12, 2015, Edward Nelson
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Edward L Nelson in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  30 days jail - credit for 30 days.  Court orders Time Served.  
- Court Costs of $243.00  - Court orders credit of 5 days to offset the costs. Costs are paid in full.
- DNA Surcharge of  $200.00 - Court orders 4 days credit to offset the surcharge. Surcharge is paid in full.

Defendant Edward L Nelson in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense was not aware her client was in custody and requests another date for plea/sentencing as soon as possible. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/5/15.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with Waukesha City Police Department unless in an emergency.   Defendant to have no contact with Lisa M or the Metro Transit Security.

Defendant Edward L Nelson in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
